chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Joseph Scheidegger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Joseph Scheidegger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas Joseph Scheidegger was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
TO BE SERVED IN PRISON
Consecutive to: current sentence.
All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Letter to the court from Glenda Scheidegger

Defendant Thomas Joseph Scheidegger appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Thomas Joseph Scheidegger. Matter is resolved. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1. State will move to dismiss Cts 2 and 3. State will recommend 2 years WSPS (1in and 1out), consecutive to a current sentence, and court costs. Court orally reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Cts 2 and 3 are dismissed per agreement. State heard. Attorney Zaleski heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 6 months in jail, consecutive to current sentence, to be served in prison, costs and DNA.

Defendant Thomas Joseph Scheidegger appeared by video, in custody at DCI.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Thomas Joseph Scheidegger. Todd Miller sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: Report- received. Cross. Redirect. State heard and requests bind over. Attorney Zaleski objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause to bind matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
